page.title: 03A LOCAL DAD'S DAY
page.content:
A Day in Our Dad's Life
Our Dad works with trees. In the winter he cuts them down to supply people with logs. In the spring he fells chestnut trees which he makes into fencing stakes and rails.Chestnut grows quickly and is ready for cutting every 15 or 20 years.This is called chestnut coppicing.To make fences he has a special tool called a shaver to remove bark,then the timber is split. This is very difficult.He has a tractor which drives a sawbench to sharpen stakes or cut logs.He makes all sorts of fencing.It is used by farmers for keeping their stock in,gardeners and other fencing contractors in Kent and Sussex.My Dad tells us he is very lucky to be able to earn a living by doing a job he loves. Alan and Neil Crouch.
